The most obvious reason to push this stock price down is to make a killing in China. Anyone who doesn't catch on to this, must be blind or naive. Daqo has proven that the Shanghai IPO's fetch a massive premium, and that in China, these companies get valued as their peers do (Trina, JA Solar, Tongwei, Xinte, etc.) By pushing the price as low as possible, any hedge fund (could be Morgan Stanley, too, since the STAR IPO is not only available to Chinese investors) that can get in on that IPO can buy up an ever larger percentage of Jinko for practically nothing, and make a fortune the first day this baby trades in STAR. As I already posted, if the Jinko price can be kept around $40-50, they'll have to sell 25% or more to get the $1B capital they are looking to get, leaving us US longs with less than 50% of the company, but without any gurantees that arbitraging will happen. (It's certainly not happening for DQ....) I'm ever more convinced of the fact that there are powerful hedge funds behind this to walk away with billions in a few months. A no brainer....

They had 31 GW capacity at end of June, and if they get close to the 30GW high-end prediction (I consider that unlikely, but would be very happy with 28 GW), it would be a fairly decent utilization rate compared to the industry average. Even if the added no further capacity in 2022, it would imply that Jinko could be selling close to about $10B worth of products by the end of 2022. Jinko’s listing on the STAR market is likely to happen in the next few months, earlier than the 2022 that was previously expected. The valuation is also likely to be 50% to 100% higher than the valuation in the US market. This will allow them to raise larger amounts of capital at much lower cost and even pay down some debt. This would be the mecahnism by which the price and valuation gap between US and Chonese markets will narrow.

US shareholders own ZERO of the company. The ADS shares of Chinese companies are structured that way that they do NOT own any part of the company. So if Junko or Daqo decides to pull out of the US stock market they can do that with US shareholders getting ZERO. There is a great article about that on WSJ. I suggest you guys read it.

Jinko has set up this year's sales in such a way that the Q4 estimates will be out early December where they are going to significantly increase both module sales, revenue and hopefully profit margin. This is a critical chess move to maximize the valuation of Jinko shares in the US, so that the IPO price in Shanghai can be set as high as possible. If the timing between meeting requirements on STAR SSE (Shanghai Stock Exchange), registration process, IPO price setting by SSE and first day of trading is similar to Daqo’s, then for Jinko this would be late Sept 21, early January 22, late January 22, and mid-February 22, respectively. The key is that between Q4 estimates in December and price setting of IPO shares late January, the US investment big shots respond to their Q4 results and move this stock past $100. Otherwise, we longs are going to be diluted by a lot more than we should be if the market were even remotely logical with JKS stock. Jinko has done everything possible to make themselves and US shareholders get rich with their stock.
